intro: Hypericum samaniense, commonly known as the Saman hypericum, is a flowering plant belonging to the genus Hypericum in the family Clusiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features erect, branching stems with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, producing small, orange-red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
